title: Quick Start
content: # 🚀 Quick Start Guide: Arweave + AO Development

title: Quick Start
content: Welcome to the **Arweave + AO Quick Start Guide**! This guide will help you get up and running as quickly as possible with Arweave’s **permanent storage** and AO’s **decentralized compute**.

title: Quick Start
Quick Start
content: 🏦 Step 1: Create and Fund Your Wallet (Optional if Done)

title: Quick Start
content: To interact with Arweave and AO, you need an **Arweave-compatible wallet**.

title: Quick Start
content: If you don’t have a wallet yet, follow our **[Wallet Creation Guide](./developers/get-started/wallets/create-wallet)** for step-by-step instructions on setting up a Wander Wallet.

title: Quick Start
content: Once you have a wallet, you'll need **AR tokens** to pay for transactions. Learn how to acquire and transfer AR tokens in our **[Funding Guide](./developers/get-started/wallets/fund-wallet)**.

title: Quick Start
content: For local development and testing, you can use **ArLocal** to simulate the Arweave network without spending real AR tokens. Refer to our **[Local Arweave Setup Guide](./local-arweave-setup.md)** for detailed instructions. -->

title: Quick Start

title: Local Arweave
content: # 🛠️ Setting Up Local Arweave with ArLocal

title: Local Arweave
content: ArLocal is a tool that allows developers to quickly set up a **local Arweave gateway** for testing transactions in a **simulated environment**. This enables you to interact with Arweave without spending AR tokens, making development and testing easier.

title: Local Arweave
content: Ensure you have **Node.js** and **npm** or **yarn** installed on your machine.

title: Local Arweave
content: If Node.js is not installed, download it from [nodejs.org](https://nodejs.org/).

title: Local Arweave
content: By default, this will start an Arweave gateway on **port 1984**.

title: Local Arweave
content: You can specify a different port:

title: Local Arweave
content: #### 📌 Option 2: Installing as a Dev Dependency

title: Local Arweave
content: For persistent usage, install ArLocal as a **dev dependency** in your project:

title: Local Arweave
content: Then, create a script in your `package.json`:

title: Local Arweave
content: Now, you can start ArLocal with:

title: Local Arweave
content: ## 🔄 Using ArLocal in a Node.js Script

title: Local Arweave
content: You can integrate ArLocal into your **Node.js** test environment programmatically:

title: Local Arweave
content: const arLocal = new ArLocal(); // Create an instance

title: Local Arweave
content: await arLocal.start(); // Start local Arweave instance

title: Local Arweave
content: await arLocal.stop(); // Stop ArLocal after testing

title: Local Arweave
content: const arLocal = new ArLocal(1985, true, "./arlocal_db", true);

title: Local Arweave
content: ## 🔬 Example: Posting a Transaction to ArLocal

title: Local Arweave
content: // Airdrop AR tokens to the wallet (for local use)

title: Local Arweave
content: await arLocal.stop(); // Stop ArLocal after testing

title: Local Arweave
content: ✅ **ArLocal provides a local Arweave testing environment**

title: Local Arweave
content: ✅ **Quickly test transactions without spending AR tokens**

title: Local Arweave
content: ✅ **Run with npx or install as a dependency**

title: Local Arweave
content: ✅ **Use Arweave.js to interact with the local instance**

title: Local Arweave
content: 🚀 **Now you're ready to build & test Arweave applications locally!** 🔥

title: Setting up AOS
content: AOS (AO Operating System) is the command-line interface (CLI) and runtime environment for **AO: The Hyper Parallel Computer**. It allows developers to build and interact with AO processes (similar to smart contracts) and leverage AO’s decentralized compute model.

title: Setting up AOS
content: Before installing **AOS**, ensure you have the following dependencies installed:

title: Setting up AOS
content: To install **AOS**, run the following command:

title: Setting up AOS
content: After running `aos` for the first time, it installs itself on your machine.

title: Setting up AOS
content: Next time, you can simply run:

title: Setting up AOS
content: If you want to build AOS from source or modify it, follow these steps:

title: Setting up AOS
content: In AOS, **Processes** are like smart contracts that execute code. You can create and interact with these processes using the CLI.

title: Setting up AOS
content: To create a new AO Process:

title: Setting up AOS
content: Once a process is created, you can start interacting with it by running:

title: Setting up AOS
content: AOS supports various flags to customize how a process runs:

title: Setting up AOS
content: | `--relay [Relay URL]`   | Enables payment processing via HyperBEAM relay |

title: Setting up AOS
content: | `--cron [Interval]`     | Executes the process at specified intervals (e.g., `10-minutes`, `5-hours`, `10-blocks`) |

title: Setting up AOS
content: | `--get-blueprints [dir]` | Loads predefined **Lua scripts** (blueprints) into the process |

title: Setting up AOS
content: | `--load [luaFile]`      | Loads a Lua script from a local file |

title: Setting up AOS
content: | `--sqlite`              | Uses SQLite module for local storage within AOS |

title: Setting up AOS
content: | `--tag-name [name]` `--tag-value [value]` | Adds metadata tags to the process |

title: Setting up AOS
content: ## 📜 6. Deploying a Process with Boot Scripts

title: Setting up AOS
content: AOS allows you to **auto-run Lua scripts** when a process starts. You can do this by setting the `On-Boot` tag.

title: Setting up AOS
content: ### **7.1 Setting Up AOS for Advanced Development**

title: Setting up AOS
content: If you're modifying the AOS runtime, you may need to rebuild the WebAssembly (WASM) module:

title: Setting up AOS
content: After deploying, copy the **module ID** and update your `package.json` or `README.md`.

title: Setting up AOS
content: ### 🎉 Now you are ready to run **AOS** and start building decentralized applications using **AO: The Hyper Parallel Computer!** 🚀

title: Deploy your first app!
content: # 🚀 Deploy Your AO + React App to Arweave with ArLink

title: Deploy your first app!
content: You’ve built your app — now it’s time to **go live** on the **permaweb** using [Arweave](https://www.arweave.org) and **ArLink**.

title: Deploy your first app!
content: **Arweave** isn't just for storing images or files; it can also host your **entire application permanently**. However, specific configurations are necessary to ensure your app works correctly on the permaweb.

title: Deploy your first app!
content: Arweave operates as a decentralized storage network without traditional server-side routing. This means client-side routing configurations (e.g. `HashRouter`) are crucial. Without them, users may encounter broken links or refresh errors.

title: Deploy your first app!
content: ## ⚠️ Important: Wallet Must Have AR Tokens

title: Deploy your first app!
content: To deploy your app, your wallet **must contain AR tokens**. These are used to pay for storage. Without AR tokens, deployment **will fail**.

title: Deploy your first app!
content: You can deploy your app in **two ways**:

title: Deploy your first app!
content: 🌐 Option 1: Use the ArLink Web Interface

title: Deploy your first app!
content: You can deploy via the **no-code UI** at:

title: Deploy your first app!
content: > If you're used to deploying apps with Vercel, this will feel right at home — simple, clean, and developer-friendly.

title: Deploy your first app!
content: For a step-by-step guide, follow the official ArLink docs:

title: Deploy your first app!
content: 🧱 Option 2: Local CLI + ArNS (Advanced)

title: Deploy your first app!
content: This method uses **ArNS** (Arweave Name System), a decentralized naming system for Arweave.

title: Deploy your first app!
content: 3. Click which wallet account you want to use to deploy your application.

title: Deploy your first app!
content: 🚫 **DO NOT COMMIT THIS FILE** — add `.secrets/` to your `.gitignore`

title: Deploy your first app!
content: <pre><code class="language-sh" title="scripts/deploy.sh" description="Shell script to deploy your dist/ folder to Arweave using ArNS and permaweb-deploy.">

title: Deploy your first app!
content: echo "dist directory does not exist. Please build the project first"

title: Deploy your first app!
content: echo "UNDERNAME is not set. Setting it to arweb"

title: Deploy your first app!
content: To obtain your ArNS name, visit the ArNS dashboard, which would be the Process ID of the asset. You will need to either rent or buy an ArNS name.

title: Deploy your first app!
content: Update the `--ant-process` value in the script to your ArNS name:

title: Deploy your first app!
content: Update the `--undername` value in the script to your desired ArNS name (this can be anything you choose):

title: Deploy your first app!
content: You’ll get a live URL like:

title: Deploy your first app!
content: You can link a custom domain to your Arweave deployment using TXT records.

title: Creating your wallet
content: Wander is a popular Arweave-compatible wallet that allows you to interact with **decentralized applications (dApps)** and manage digital assets on the **Arweave and AO networks**. Follow this guide to set up your **Wander wallet**.

title: Creating your wallet
content: ## 🛠 Step 1: Install the Wander Browser Extension

title: Creating your wallet
content: - Visit the official Wander extension page:

title: Creating your wallet
content: - Click **"Add to Chrome"** and confirm any installation prompts.

title: Creating your wallet
content: - Once installed, the Wander icon will appear in your browser toolbar.

title: Creating your wallet
content: 1. Click on the **Wander** extension icon in your browser toolbar.

title: Creating your wallet
content: 4. Wander will generate a **12-word seed phrase**.

title: Creating your wallet
content: 5. **Write it down** and store it in a **secure location**.

title: Creating your wallet
content: 6. **DO NOT** share this phrase with anyone. It is the only way to recover your wallet.

title: Creating your wallet
content: 7. **Confirm the seed phrase** by entering it in the correct order.

title: Creating your wallet
content: 8. Set a **strong password** that will be used to unlock your wallet.

title: Creating your wallet
content: 9. Follow the rest of the prompts.

title: Creating your wallet
content: 10. Congratulations! Your account is finally created!

title: Creating your wallet
content: 5. Set a **strong password** that will be used to unlock your wallet.

title: Creating your wallet
content: 🎉 **Congratulations!** You’ve successfully created your Wander wallet and are now ready to explore the Arweave and AO ecosystems with your new digital assets!

title: Creating your wallet
content: ## 🚀 Step 3: Access and Manage Your Wallet

title: Creating your wallet
content: Once setup is complete, you will be redirected to the **Wander Dashboard**, where you can:

title: Funding your wallet
content: To interact with the Arweave and AO ecosystems using your Wander wallet, you'll need to acquire **AR tokens**. Here's a step-by-step guide to help you fund your wallet.

title: Funding your wallet
content: **AR tokens** are the native cryptocurrency of the Arweave network. You can purchase them through various cryptocurrency exchanges. Here's how:

title: Funding your wallet
content: Select a reputable exchange that supports AR token trading. Some popular exchanges include:

title: Funding your wallet
content: - Sign up on the chosen exchange and complete any necessary verification processes.

title: Funding your wallet
content: - Add funds to your exchange account using your preferred payment method (e.g., bank transfer, credit card).

title: Funding your wallet
content: - Navigate to the trading section and buy the desired amount of AR tokens.

title: Funding your wallet
content: ## 🏦 Step 2: Transfer AR Tokens to Your Wander Wallet

title: Funding your wallet
content: After purchasing AR tokens, transfer them to your Wander wallet:

title: Funding your wallet
content: - Launch the Wander extension or mobile app.

title: Funding your wallet
content: - Locate and copy your unique wallet address. This is typically found under the "Receive" section.

title: Funding your wallet
content: - In your exchange account, go to the withdrawal section.

title: Funding your wallet
content: - Enter the amount of AR tokens to transfer.

title: Funding your wallet
content: - Blockchain transactions may take some time. Once confirmed, your AR tokens will appear in your Wander wallet.

title: Funding your wallet
content: For more detailed instructions and support, refer to Wander's official help articles:

title: Funding your wallet
content: - [How to buy AR tokens with fiat currency](https://www.wander.app/help/browser-extension-how-to-buy-ar-tokens-with-a-fiat-currency)

title: Funding your wallet
content: **Note:** Ensure you're sending AR tokens to the correct wallet address. Transactions on the blockchain are irreversible.

title: What are Atomic Assets?
content: In the evolving landscape of **digital ownership and decentralized storage**, Atomic Assets emerge as a **groundbreaking solution**. Built on **Arweave**, they integrate **data, metadata, and licensing** into a **single immutable identifier**.

title: What are Atomic Assets?
content: An **Atomic Asset** is a **digital package** that consolidates:

title: What are Atomic Assets?
content: Unlike **traditional NFTs**, which often rely on **off-chain storage**, Atomic Assets ensure:

title: What are Atomic Assets?
content: - **Multiple users to own portions** of a single asset.

title: What are Atomic Assets?
content: - **Seamless buying, selling, and trading** within the asset itself.

title: What are Atomic Assets?
content: - **No reliance on third-party platforms** for ownership validation.

title: What are Atomic Assets?
content: Atomic Assets utilize the **Universal Data License (UDL)**:

title: What are Atomic Assets?
content: Atomic Assets **redefine digital content ownership** by ensuring **permanence, fractional ownership, and clear licensing**. As **NFTs evolve**, Atomic Assets stand as the **next-generation standard** for **secure and immutable digital assets**.

title: What are Atomic Assets?
content: Atomic Assets represent a **significant advancement in digital assets**, addressing the **limitations of traditional NFTs** by:

title: What are Atomic Assets?
content: - **Facilitating fractional ownership** (multiple owners can hold stakes).

title: What are Atomic Assets?
content: As the digital landscape evolves, Atomic Assets provide a **reliable foundation** for creators seeking **permanence, security, and clear ownership**.

title: UDL in Depth
content: The **Universal Data License (UDL)** offers **creators full control** over **usage, licensing, and monetization** of digital assets.

title: UDL in Depth
content: - Decide if **content can be used** for **AI training** or **data models**.

title: UDL in Depth
content: 1. **Attach a UDL license** to digital assets.

title: UDL in Depth
content: The **UDL empowers creators** by **providing legal clarity, monetization options, and full control** over digital content.

title: UDL in Depth
content: The **Universal Data License (UDL)** is a **standardized framework** that enables **content creators** to:

title: UDL in Depth
content: - **Define usage terms** (commercial use, modifications, derivative works).

title: UDL in Depth
content: - **Monetize digital assets** via **one-time fees, subscriptions, or pay-per-access models**.

title: UDL in Depth
content: By leveraging **decentralized storage on Arweave**, the **UDL ensures long-term protection** for **creators & their intellectual property**.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: UCM BazAR is a **decentralized compute platform** built on **Arweave** that enables **massively parallel computations**.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: Unlike **traditional cloud computing**, UCM BazAR provides:

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: - Task managers that assign jobs to computing nodes.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: - Ensure efficient distribution of processing power.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: - Ensure seamless coordination between computing nodes.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: ✅ **Infinite scalability** → Computation scales as demand grows.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: ✅ **Permanent storage** → All computations & results are stored immutably.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: ✅ **Fully decentralized** → No central authority controls the system.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: - **AI and Machine Learning** → Train complex models in a decentralized environment.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: - **Web3 Social Media** → Fully decentralized social networks with no central control.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: UCM BazAR is the **next major evolution in decentralized computing**, providing an **infinitely scalable, censorship-resistant infrastructure**.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: UCM BazAR is a **decentralized hyper-parallel compute layer** built on **Arweave**.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: UCM BazAR operates like a **Virtual Private Server (VPS) on Arweave** but **scales infinitely**, making it ideal for:

title: Funding Wallet
content: The **Funding Wallet** in UCM BazAR is designed to **handle decentralized transactions seamlessly**.

title: Funding Wallet
content: - Digital assets are **permanently stored** on Arweave.

title: Funding Wallet
content: - Computation fees are **paid dynamically** without user intervention.

title: Funding Wallet
content: - Users can fund computations using **AR tokens, stablecoins, or other assets**.

title: Funding Wallet
content: The **Funding Wallet** makes UCM BazAR a **fully self-sustaining, decentralized computing ecosystem**.

title: Funding Wallet
content: UCM BazAR utilizes a **Funding Wallet System** to manage decentralized transactions.

title: Funding Wallet
content: - **Automatic computation funding** → No manual intervention needed.

title: Funding Wallet
content: - **Supports multiple assets** → AR, stablecoins, and other crypto.

content: UCM BazAR provides a **fully decentralized infrastructure** for **creating & managing Atomic Assets**.

title: Creating Your Own Atomic Assets
content: - Use **Universal Data License (UDL)** to specify usage rights.

title: Creating Your Own Atomic Assets
content: - Atomic Assets can be **split into multiple ownership stakes**.

content: Atomic Assets ensure **truly decentralized, user-controlled content**, redefining **NFTs & digital asset management**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: Arweave is a groundbreaking **decentralized storage protocol** designed to provide **permanent data storage solutions**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: Unlike traditional storage systems that require recurring payments and are susceptible to data loss or censorship, Arweave offers a unique **"pay once, store forever"** model. This approach ensures that **data remains immutable and perpetually accessible**, revolutionizing how information is preserved in the digital age.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: At the core of Arweave's architecture is the **blockweave**, an innovative data structure that differentiates it from conventional blockchains:

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - Traditional blockchains form a linear sequence.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - Arweave's **blockweave links each block to both the previous block and a randomly selected earlier block**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - This enhances **data redundancy** and plays a key role in the network’s **Proof of Access (PoA)** consensus mechanism.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: When users upload data, they **pay a one-time fee in AR tokens**:

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - A portion is allocated to a **storage endowment**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - The endowment generates **returns to compensate miners**, ensuring **data remains available indefinitely**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: Arweave fosters a **community-driven ecosystem** where developers can build:

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - **Gateways** that provide seamless access to stored data.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - [Arweave for Newbies: How It Works and Why It Exists](https://x.com/onlyarweave/status/1805983704549929286)

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: Arweave is a decentralized protocol designed for **permanent data storage**, allowing users to preserve information indefinitely with a single, one-time fee.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: Secured by a network of **miners rewarded with AR tokens**, Arweave ensures data is replicated and remains accessible through a **sustainable endowment model**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: This approach supports the **permaweb**—a collection of permanent web pages and applications **free from centralized control**, fostering a space where **history and culture are preserved**, and **free speech is upheld**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: Developers are empowered to create **fully decentralized applications** on the permaweb, contributing to a more **resilient and open internet**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - [Arweave for Newbies: How It Works and Why It Exists](https://x.com/onlyarweave/status/1805983704549929286)

title: The Permaweb and Its Applications
content: The **permaweb** is a revolutionary concept **built on top of Arweave**, creating a **decentralized and immutable web**.

title: The Permaweb and Its Applications
content: Unlike the **traditional internet**, which is **vulnerable to data loss**, the permaweb ensures that once information is uploaded, it **is stored forever**.

title: The Permaweb and Its Applications
content: - The traditional web relies on **centralized servers**, meaning data can be **lost if a server shuts down**.

title: The Permaweb and Its Applications
content: - The permaweb distributes content **across a global network of nodes**.

title: The Permaweb and Its Applications
content: ## **What Can Be Built on the Permaweb?**

title: The Permaweb and Its Applications
content: Beyond static files, developers can create **full-fledged decentralized applications (dApps)** that:

title: The Permaweb and Its Applications
content: - **Gateways** → Act as access points for retrieving and displaying stored data.

title: The Permaweb and Its Applications
content: - **GraphQL APIs** → Enable users to efficiently query stored data.

title: The Permaweb and Its Applications
content: - **Profit-Sharing Communities (PSCs)** → Allow developers to distribute revenue and governance to users.

title: The Permaweb and Its Applications

title: The Permaweb and Its Applications
content: The **permaweb** is a **permanent, decentralized web** built on Arweave. It **eliminates broken links and missing content**, ensuring that data and applications remain **permanently accessible**.

title: The Permaweb and Its Applications
content: Beyond simple **file storage**, the permaweb hosts **full-fledged decentralized applications** that:

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: One of the biggest challenges in **blockchain-based storage solutions** is **scalability**. Arweave tackles this challenge through **unique innovations** that allow it to scale indefinitely.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: Unlike **contract-based storage systems** that require complex verification, Arweave applies a **single set of rules**:

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **"Pay once, store forever"** → Eliminates the need for constant payment models.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **All transactions follow the same storage principles**, reducing processing complexity.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: Instead of processing transactions individually, Arweave allows:

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **Multiple transactions to be combined into a single bundle**.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: This process is governed by the **Arweave Network Standard -104**, ensuring efficiency.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: When too many transactions are submitted, **recursive bundling** is used:

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **Bundles are combined into larger bundles before submission**.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - This allows an **unlimited number of transactions** in a single Arweave operation.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: Arweave’s **storage model assumes costs will decrease over time**, making it:

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **More efficient than traditional cloud storage solutions**.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - [How Arweave Scales: Storing All the Data on the Web](https://arweave.org/)

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - [Arweave for Newbies: How It Works and Why It Exists](https://x.com/onlyarweave/status/1805983704549929286)

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: Arweave achieves **scalability** through several key innovations:

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **Transaction bundling** → Multiple transactions are combined into a single block, improving efficiency.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **Blockweave structure** → Uses a **Proof of Access (PoA) consensus** to ensure redundancy.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **Recursive bundling** → Transactions can be **bundled within bundles**, enabling **theoretical infinite scalability**.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: These innovations make Arweave a **robust solution for decentralized, permanent data storage**.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - [How Arweave Scales: Storing All the Data on the Web](https://arweave.org/)

title: Introduction to AO
content: AO is a **decentralized compute platform** built on Arweave that introduces a **revolutionary way to process and execute computations at scale**.

title: Introduction to AO
content: Unlike traditional **cloud or blockchain systems**, which have **limited processing power**, AO uses **hyper-parallel computing**, allowing **unlimited simultaneous tasks**.

title: Introduction to AO
content: - Support complex applications such as **AI models, validator nodes, and dApps**.

title: Introduction to AO
content: - **Integrates with Arweave for permanent data storage**.

title: Introduction to AO
content: - **Artificial Intelligence (AI)** → Train and run AI models in a decentralized environment.

title: Introduction to AO
content: - **Decentralized Finance (DeFi)** → Supports on-chain validation and smart contract execution.

title: Introduction to AO
content: AO is a **decentralized hyper-parallel compute** layer built on **Arweave**.

title: Introduction to AO
content: AO functions like a **VPS on Arweave** but **scales infinitely**, supporting:

title: AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
content: AO operates on a **decentralized computing model** consisting of three major components: **Messages, Processes, and the AO Grid**. These allow AO to execute computations in a **highly scalable and efficient manner**.

title: AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
content: AO is built around **two core elements**:

title: AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
content: - **Messages** → Data packets that instruct the system on **what tasks to execute**.

title: AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
content: AO introduces a **Holographic State model**, eliminating the need for **shared global state**. Instead of maintaining an entire network-wide state, AO **computes state on demand**, improving efficiency.

title: AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
content: ## **2. The AO Grid: Three Core Units**

title: AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
content: AO’s infrastructure consists of **three primary unit types**:

AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
content: - Retrieve necessary data and return computed results.

title: AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
content: - **Horizontally scalable** → New units can be added dynamically.

title: AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
content: - **No shared state** → Processes compute on demand.

title: AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
content: - **Perfect for AI & onchain applications** → Eliminates bottlenecks seen in traditional blockchain models.

content: - **Scheduler Units (SUs)** → Order and store messages on Arweave.

AO's Core Architecture: How It Works
content: By leveraging these components, AO can **scale infinitely**, making it ideal for **onchain applications, AI, and decentralized computing**.

AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: One of AO’s defining features is its ability to **scale infinitely through parallel execution**. Unlike traditional blockchain systems that rely on **sequential execution**, AO enables **modular and on-demand computation**.

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: AO functions as a **distributed supercomputer**, running **countless computations simultaneously**.

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: - **No global state** → Each process retrieves only the data it needs.

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: AO messages follow a structured workflow:

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: 2. **Scheduler Unit (SU)** → Orders messages and stores them permanently on Arweave.

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: 3. **Compute Unit (CU)** → Processes messages and executes logic.

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: This ensures **high throughput** while maintaining **decentralized security**.

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: With its **hyper-parallel design**, AO is well-suited for:

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: - **Web3 & Smart Contracts** → Runs complex smart contracts efficiently.

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: - **Decentralized AI** → Handles AI training & model execution.

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: - **Onchain Virtual Worlds** → Powers interactive, persistent metaverse environments.

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: AO achieves **infinite scalability** by executing tasks **in parallel**.

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: - **Modular, on-demand computation** → No shared global state.

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: - **Dynamic Compute Expansion** → More Compute Units (CUs) can be added as needed.

title: AO's Scalability and Parallel Processing
content: This makes AO **ideal for Web3, AI, and high-performance onchain applications**.

title: Comparing Web2 Full Stack Applications
content: ## 🚀 How is Arweave + AO Different from Traditional Full-Stack Applications?

title: Comparing Web2 Full Stack Applications
content: | Feature            | Traditional Full-Stack Apps | Arweave + AO The Computer |

title: Comparing Web2 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Storage**       | Relies on centralized databases (SQL, NoSQL, Firebase, AWS, etc.) | Uses Arweave’s **permanent** decentralized storage with a "pay once, store forever" model |

title: Comparing Web2 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Compute**       | Uses centralized servers (AWS, DigitalOcean, Vercel, etc.) | AO provides **decentralized, parallelized execution** for smart contracts & compute tasks |

title: Comparing Web2 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Data Ownership** | Controlled by corporations, prone to censorship | **Immutable & permissionless**, controlled by users |

title: Comparing Web2 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Scalability**   | Limited by server infrastructure | **Infinite scalability** with decentralized compute units |

title: Comparing Web2 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Security**      | Server hacks and data loss risks | **Trustless & censorship-resistant**, no single point of failure |

title: Comparing Web2 Full Stack Applications
content: - **No servers:** You don’t need AWS, Firebase, or Vercel. Everything is **on-chain**.

title: Comparing Web2 Full Stack Applications
content: - **Immutable Storage:** Unlike centralized databases, **Arweave permanently stores** your data.

title: Comparing Web2 Full Stack Applications
content: - **Decentralized Compute:** AO acts like a **Web3 CPU**, running decentralized processes in parallel.

title: Comparing Web2 Full Stack Applications

content: | **Compute**       | Uses centralized servers (AWS, DigitalOcean, Vercel, etc.) | AO provides **decentralized, parallelized execution** for smart contracts & compute tasks |

title: Comparing Web2 Full Stack Applications
content: - **Decentralized Compute:** AO acts like a **Web3 CPU**, running decentralized processes in parallel.

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: ## ⚡ How is Arweave + AO Different from Other Web3 Ecosystems?

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: | Feature            | Ethereum / Solana / Polygon | Arweave + AO The Computer |

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Storage**       | Uses IPFS/Filecoin (temporary, unreliable) | **Arweave stores data permanently** with no expiration |

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Smart Contracts** | Runs on Ethereum/Solana (gas fees, limited compute) | **AO provides infinitely scalable compute** with parallel processing |

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Execution Model** | Sequential transactions (slow, expensive gas fees) | **Parallel execution** for near-instant processing |

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Scalability**   | L2 solutions required (Optimism, Arbitrum) | **Native horizontal scaling** via AO Compute Units |

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Interoperability** | Limited to EVM-based chains | **AO can run smart contracts & dApps for multiple chains** |

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: - **Arweave is the only blockchain with **permanent storage** (others use temporary IPFS).**

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: - **AO brings parallel compute**, removing blockchain limitations like high gas fees.

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: - **Unlike Ethereum, AO scales infinitely without Layer 2 solutions.**

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: ## 🛠️ How Are Applications Built on Arweave + AO Different?

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Aspect**            | **Web2 Full-Stack Apps**                          | **Web3 Ecosystems (Ethereum, Solana, IPFS, etc.)**               | **Arweave + AO The Computer**                          |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Hosting & Backend** | Uses centralized cloud providers (AWS, Firebase, Vercel) | Some decentralized hosting (IPFS, Filecoin) but limited permanence | Fully decentralized hosting & compute (Arweave + AO) |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Storage**          | Databases like PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Firebase (data can be altered/deleted) | Uses IPFS/Filecoin (but requires pinning to keep data accessible) | **Arweave provides permanent, immutable storage** |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Compute Execution** | Runs on centralized servers (Node.js, Python, Go, etc.) | Smart contracts execute on-chain (Ethereum/Solana) but limited in scope | **AO enables scalable, parallel, decentralized execution** |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Smart Contracts**  | Uses Node.js, Python, Express for API logic | Solidity (Ethereum), Rust (Solana) | **AO uses Lua for execution, SmartWeave for contract logic** |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Databases**        | SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, Firebase) | Indexed event logs, IPFS/Filecoin for partial data storage | **Databases can be written inside AO (currently SQLite3)** |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Frontend & Routing** | Uses Next.js, Vite, traditional SSR/CSR models | Same frameworks, but relies on blockchain nodes for querying | **Same frontend stack (Next.js, Vite, React)**, routing works differently (Arweave gateways instead of servers) |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **Frontend development stays the same** → You still use Next.js, Vite, TailwindCSS, etc.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **Routing system differs** → Since Arweave stores content permanently, it uses gateways instead of standard API-based routing.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **No backend servers needed** → Instead of Express.js, FastAPI, or Node-based backends, AO acts as the backend & middleware.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **AO uses Lua** for execution → If you need complex logic, AO replaces the backend with **Lua-based compute**.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **Databases inside AO** → Instead of Firebase/PostgreSQL, you can write **SQLite3 databases inside AO**.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
